{{Expand German|topic=geo|date=February 2009|Albstadt}} {{Infobox German location |image_coa = Wappen Albstadt.svg |image_photo=Ebingen.jpg |image_caption=A view of Ebingen. |coordinates = {{coord|48|12|43|N|09|01|26|E|format=dms|display=inline,title}} |image_plan = Albstadt in BL.svg |state = Baden-Württemberg |region = Tübingen |district = Zollernalbkreis |elevation = 731 |area = 134.41 |Population = 44578 |Stand = 2014-06-30 |Gemeindeschlüssel = 08417079 |postal_code = 72421–72461 |PLZ-alt = 7470 |area_code = 07431, 07432, 07435 |licence = BL |website = [https://www.albstadt.de/ www.albstadt.de] |mayor = Klaus Konzelmann |party = Freie Wähler }} '''Albstadt''' ({{IPA-de|ˈalpʃtat|-|Albstadt.ogg}}) is the largest city in the [[districts of Germany|district]] of [[Zollernalbkreis]] in [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It is located on the [[Swabian Jura|Swabian '' Alb'']] mountains, about halfway between [[Stuttgart]] and [[Lake of Constance]].
== Geography == Albstadt is spread across a variety of hills and valleys, its elevation ranges between {{convert|614|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} above sea level and {{convert|966|m|ft|0|abbr=on}}. One valley is the river [[Schmiecha]], a left-hand tributary of the [[Danube]], a second valley is the river of upper [[Eyach (Neckar)|Eyach]], a tributary of the [[Neckar]].
To Albstadt belongs also the [[Raichberg]] hill in the north, on which there is the [[Raichberg Transmitter]] and an observation tower located. South of Albstadt is the [[Heuberg Training Area|Heuberg Military Training Area]].
== History == Settlement in the region dates back to at least the [[Iron Age]]. A [[Hallstatt culture|Hallstatt]] cemetery in Albstadt was excavated by amateur archaeologists in the late nineteenth century and revealed a wide range of pottery and metal artefacts. Known as the 'Degerfeld Barrow' [[cemetery]], a substantial collection was built up by the local antiquary Hyronimus Edelmann that was eventually deposited in the [[British Museum]].<ref>[http://www.schwarzwaelder-bote.de/inhalt.albstadt-ein-apotheker-geht-auf-schatzsuche.f1c6f53e-331a-4949-8e70-8e3f6a51d0ee.html Schwarzwaelder-bote website]</ref><ref>[https://www.britishmuseum.org/research/collection_online/search.aspx?searchText=Degerfeld British Museum Collection]</ref>
== Mining ==
In former times iron ore was produced in Albstadt. Fidel Eppler was the name of the mine-inspector. The buttress wood was bought in Truchtelfingen and used from Lautlinger Knappen at the Hörnle area .<ref>{{citation|surname1=Hermann Bitzer|editor-surname1= Hermann Bitzer Studienrat Rosenfeld †1964|title=Tailfinger Heimatbuch 1954|page=35|language=German}}</ref> From an old 3,5 km mine in a Doggererzflöz in [[Rietheim-Weilheim|Weilheim]] is wood in the Tuttlinger Fruchtkasten .<ref name="Ludwigsthal">Fruchtkasten: ''[https://www.tuttlingen.de/de/Die-Stadt/Tuttlingen-aktuell/Pressemitteilungen/Pressemitteilung?view=publish&item=article&id=6581https://www.tuttlingen.de/de/Die-Stadt/Tuttlingen-aktuell/Pressemitteilungen/Pressemitteilung?view=publish&item=article&id=6581 Abteilung Ludwigsthal].'' In: ''Pressemiteilungen.'' 21.November 2016.</ref> Steel was produced in [[Tuttlingen]] by the Schwäbische Hüttenwerke in Ludwigstal, today iron brakes.
The districts Ebingen, Laufen, Lautlingen, Pfeffingen und Tailfingen were first mentioned in 793 in a document of the abbey St. Gallen. [[Ebingen]] received city rights around 1250 from the [[House of Hohenberg|Hohenberg]] ducal family.
Albstadt consists of the following urban districts, which had been independent towns and merged to form Albstadt in 1975: [[Image:Truchtelfingen.jpg|thumb|Truchtelfingen and Tailfingen]] {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! Coat of Arms || [[File:Wappen Ebingen.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Tailfingen.png|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Onstmettingen.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Truchtelfingen.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Pfeffingen.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Lautlingen.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Laufen an der Eyach.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Margrethausen2.png|40px|Coat of Arms]] || [[File:Wappen Burgfelden.svg|40px|Coat of Arms]] |- !District | [[Ebingen]] || [[Tailfingen (Albstadt)]] || [[Onstmettingen]] || [[Truchtelfingen]] || [[Pfeffingen (Albstadt)]] || [[Lautlingen (Albstadt)]] || [[Laufen (Albstadt)]] || [[Margrethausen]] || [[Burgfelden]] |- ! == Economy == Most of the textiles industry (among them [[Hasana J. Hakenmüller]]) is gone today, leaving some monuments, like [[Villa Haux]]. However, one of the world's biggest makers of industrial needles, [[Groz-Beckert]] still resides there. Other prominent local companies include Mey (knitwear), [[Mettler Toledo]] (weighing systems) and a major part of [[Assa Abloy]] security systems (Eff-Eff Brand). Ebingen also hosts the technical and computer science faculties of [[Albstadt-Sigmaringen University]] with about 3,000 students (2014).
==Number of inhabitants== * 1975: 50.772 * 1987: 46.369 * 1995: 49.463 * 2005: 46.505 * 2015: 44.431
==Lord Mayors of Albstadt== * 1975–1991: Hans Pfarr (CDU) * 1991–1999: Hans-Martin Haller (SPD) * 1999–2015: Jürgen Gneveckow (CDU) * since 2015: Klaus Konzelmann (Free voters Baden-Württemberg)
==Sons and daughters of the town== [[File:Bundesarchiv B 145 Bild-F024017-0001, Oberhausen, CDU-Parteitag Rheinland, Kiesinger.jpg|thumb|Kurt Georg Kiesinger Oberhausen 1967]] * [[Gregor Dorfmeister]] (also known as Manfred Gregor; born 1929), journalist and writer * Jürgen Gneveckow (born 1952 in Tailfingen), 1999-2015 mayor of Albstadt * Walther Groz (1903–2000), born in Ebingen, producer, mayor of Ebingen * [[Monika Herzig]] (born 1964), jazz musician and musicologist * [[Kurt Georg Kiesinger]] (1904–1988), lawyer and politician (CDU), Prime Minister of Baden-Württemberg (1958–1966) and Chancellor (1966–1969) * Klaus Konzelmann (born 1963 in Truchtelfingen), police official and current mayor of Albstadt
==Personalities who have worked on the ground== [[File:Matthaeus-hahn.jpg|thumb|170px|Philipp Matthäus Hahn]] * [[Ignaz Anton Demeter]] (1773-1842), 1802-1808 first Parish Councilor in Lautlingen, 1836-1842 Archbishop of Freiburg. * [[Otto Hahn]] (1879-1968), chemist, nuclear scientist, Nobel laureate. After the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute was bombed out in Berlin in the spring of 1944, he researched from June 1944 to April 1945 in [[Gäufelden|Tailfingen]]. * [[Philipp Matthäus Hahn]] (1739-1790), pastor, designer and inventor, lived in Onstmettingen from 1764-1770 * [[Claus von Stauffenberg]] (1907-1944), officer, assassin on Adolf Hitler; spent parts of his youth in Lautlingen * [[Berthold Schenk Graf von Stauffenberg]] (1905-1944), jurist, participant in the assassination attempt on Adolf Hitler; spent parts of his youth in Lautlingen * [[Martin Schaudt]] (born 1958), dressage rider
